rlssm

Getting started:

  • Installing rlssm
  • References
  • Cite
  • Development team & Contacts

How to:

  • Define and fit a model
  • Inspect a RL model fitted only on choices
  • Inspect a DDM or a RLDDM
  • Inspect a race model or a RL-race model
  • Simulate data from the diffusion decision model

Examples:

  • Import the grouped data
  • Initialise the model
  • get Rhat
  • get wAIC
  • Ungrouped
  • Grouped

import rlssm
import pandas as pd
import os

[2]:

par_path = os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.getcwd(), os.pardir))
data_path = os.path.join(par_path, 'data/data_experiment.csv')

data = pd.read_csv(data_path, index_col=0)

data = data[data.participant == 12].reset_index(drop=True)

data['block_label'] += 1

# data = data[data['trial_block'] == 1]

[3]:

model = rlssm.RLLBAModel_2A(1,
                           separate_learning_rates=True,
                           nonlinear_mapping=True)

[5]:

# sampling parameters
n_iter = 700
n_chains = 2
n_thin = 5

# learning parameters
K = 4 # n options
initial_value_learning = 17.5 # intitial value (Q0)

[6]:

model_fit = model.fit(data,
                      K,
                      initial_value_learning,
                      thin = n_thin,
                      iter = n_iter,
                      chains = n_chains)

Grouped¶

[17]:

import numpy as np

[18]:

data['choice_pair'] = 'AB'
data.loc[(data.cor_option == 3) & (data.inc_option == 1), 'choice_pair'] = 'AC'
data.loc[(data.cor_option == 4) & (data.inc_option == 2), 'choice_pair'] = 'BD'
data.loc[(data.cor_option == 4) & (data.inc_option == 3), 'choice_pair'] = 'CD'

data['block_bins'] = pd.cut(data.trial_block, 8, labels=np.arange(1, 9))
